label: Behavior 93424546
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving east-northeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 54.816375 + 0.00123 × t, lon(t) ≈ 12.53902 + 0.00113 × t, where t is a normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)

Course change: stable (COG remains consistently at 28.0° across most observations, with only one minor deviation to 27.6°, indicating negligible course change)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading is fixed at 28.0° throughout the entire sequence, showing no fluctuation)
